title.narrative: Solar Water Pumping Policy Dialogue in Tanzania

description.narrative: The cooperation with the Tanzania Renewable Energy Association (TAREA), a non-governmental non-profit network of renewable energy with around 800 members, started in March 2020.The objective of the project is enabling the adoption of solar water pumping for irrigation by smallholder farmers.To replace diesel generators and reduce the use of fossil fuel. Therefore, TAREA works on raising awareness and advocates for solar water pumping as strategic technology in policy development.The aimed impacts are increased crop production for smallholder farmers, while reducing CO2 emissions by 487KgCO2/acre/year through the use of photo voltaic pumping systems.

title.narrative: Tonnes of carbon dioxide equivalent (Mt CO2eq/yr) emissions reduced, avoided or sequestered (Ex-ante estimate)

comment.narrative: Potential: 487KgCO2/acre/year irrigation. Support to policy development to promote use of PV pumping. Ex-ante estimate

title.narrative: Number of people trained or skills developed - Female

comment.narrative:
16% of total (187) according to TAREA
13% for TBS engineers 50% in the Solar pumping workinggroup

title.narrative: Number of people trained or skills developed - Total

comment.narrative: 187 persons took part in the direct project activities. 234 persons are 187 above plus those who participated in the awareness-raising activity in Iringa and people who made the telephone calls for recommendations to buy solar irrigation pumps. TAREA email 26.11.21 Involved stakeholders: 30 from private sector and 15 from Tanzania Buro of Standards

title.narrative: Number of Institutional or Project cooperation - Total

comment.narrative: 1:TAREA with invlovement of Vice Presidents Offcie, 4 Ministries (Energy, Agriculture, Water and Finance & Planning), the National Irrigation Commission and the Tanzania Bureau of Standards through TAREA
Policy Brief with Leaflet, Lessons Learned Workshop report (agreed by Government entities), and final project report.

Site visit: 1 Fact finding missions: 4 Ministerial learning event : 1 Stakeholders’ policy dialogue work-shop: 1 Advocacy to Tanzania Bureau of Standards on solar irrigation pump standards: 1 Lessons Learned workshop: 1 Total: 9 (planned 8) Further more: - Awareness raising activitities: 4 - Meetings: 16 total -- Ministry of Energy 4+1=5 -- Ministry of Agriculture 4+1=5 -- Commission of Irrigation 3+1=4 -- Parliamentary Agricultural Committee: 1 -- Parliamentary Budget Committee: 1

Tanzania line ministries are aware of the potentials of solar water irrigation for sustainable agriculture in the context of climate change. Smallholder farmers’ crop growing is environmental safe as carbon dioxide emitted to the atmosphere is reduced. 1.0 Women are interested in the energy for agriculture as in the Working Group they were 50%. 2.0 Solar companies operating in Tanzania and Europe are interested in promoting renewable en-ergy for productive uses. 3.0 Tanzania government authorities and agencies have an interest in supporting the increase of agricultural productivity for the smallholder farmers. 4.0 There is an opportunity of scaling up the adoption of smallholder solar irrigation pump through agricultural training centres and exhibitions. 5.0 Irrigation increases productivity up to three folds compared to non-irrigated agriculture. 6.0 Mini sprinklers conserve water as they irrigate at the targeted area, better than furrow irrigation. 7.0 Solar irrigation is potential for the commercial scale. 8.0 One farmer can cause the emission of carbon dioxide up to 104.4KgCO2/day through the use of the diesel pump. 9.0 Smallholder farmers do not observe river catchment protection regulations. 10.0 Smallholder solar irrigation pump is of capacity up to 3Hp. 11.0 Pandemic is the project risk that cannot be foreseen during the planning phase. 12.0 Awareness-raising is one of the tools of scaling up the uptake of the technology. Not clear what EKN-DAR further plan are regarding follow-up. Political situation in TAN improved, direct contact and cooperation with GoT should be possible now.PUM Follow-up: Connie Valkhoff visited TAREA and discussed starting training to young people at TAREA-ATC Solar Centre in Arusha, about design and installation of solar irrigation pumps to establish human capacity at the local level, not only big companies.

title.narrative: Description of changes achieved in laws, regulations, policy plans, outcomes of social dialogue or development strategies enacted or adopted by local government or social dialogue partners, yielding tangible benefits to the business climate

comment.narrative: Solar Pumping equipement is in cluded in Irrigation Masterplan of the Ministry of Agriculture

Inclusion of SOlar Water Pumping Technology in National Irrigation in Masterplan as agriculturel implement.
Ministry of Energy, Ministry of Agriculture and the National Commission for Irrigation recognize the role of smallholder solar irrigation pumps in increasing agricultural productivity sustainably. And Tech-nical Standards for Solar water pumping (FTZS 2916 ) are adopted by the Tanzania Bureau of Stand-ards. TAREA agreed to dialogue on how to develop a policy that can support use of solar pump for irrigation, to mainstreaming renewable energy in national irrigation strategic plan, by considering SWP. TAREA to approach the government through the clauses on the technologies that are climate-friendly as published by the Vice President Office in the “National Climate Change Response Strategy 2021-2026” of 2021. And to sign MoU with the local government authorities that have plans to support the farmers with new agricultural technologies like irrigation. TAREA should follow up with the Prime Minister’s Office on the program of ASDP II that has functions of increasing agricultural productivity and safeguarding the environment/land. In addtion to write to the Permanent Secretary of the Ministry of Agriculture to request the mainstreaming of solar irrigation for smallholder agriculture in the farmers’ extension services and contact CRDB that is accredited to access Green Climate Fund to develop the financial product for the solar irrigation system. Planned to raise awareness of the potentials of the smallholder solar irrigation pump. National Irrigation Commis-sion planned to include solar irrigation in the Strategy. Proposal of the maximum capacity of smallholder pump 3Hp.
